Notes: Backbone with CAPTOR-E AESA (250 km range vs. 3m²), 4-6 Meteor/AIM-120C-5 pylons for high-Pk BVR; Tranche 4 upgrades (2025 IOC) add AI targeting and drone integration; ~24 T1, 58 T2, 56 T3, 3 T4 active across JG 31/73/74; 38 more T4 +20 T5 on order for 2060s sustainment.

Two-seat variants (T1/T2-based) with identical CAPTOR-E radar and 4 Meteor loads for BVR tactics training; supports squadron workup and operational missions; integrated with NATO Link-16 for simulated networked engagements.

Multirole with RDY-2 radar (150 km) and 4-6 Meteor/MICA upgrades (2025 rollout) for BVR strikes; nuclear-certified for NATO sharing; JaBoG 32/33 at Büchel, retaining 46 to 2025+ amid F-35 transition; SEAD-capable with HARM.

Dedicated Wild Weasel with ALQ-184 jammers to suppress radars, enabling Typhoon BVR salvos; 2025 upgrades add Meteor for self-defense; JG 32 at Büchel, ~22 operational mid-2025, replacing with 15 EK Typhoons by 2030.

Strategic/tactical transport with underwing pods for probe refueling, extending Typhoon BVR sorties by 2+ hours; 49th delivered Jun 2025 toward 53 total; LTG 62 at Wunstorf, DIRCM upgrades (23 units) for contested ops.
Joint Franco-German squadron asset for rapid fighter/radar deployment and ISR cueing; modern avionics for austere basing; 3 operational at Évreux (shared), supporting BVR surge with 2 more planned.
ELINT platform with Rivet Joint-like suite for enemy radar/missile detection (200+ km), cueing Typhoon launches via datalink; Flugbereitschaft at Köln, upgrades in 2025 for GPS-denied environments.
Legacy MRTT with hose/drogue for sustaining BVR patrols; Flugbereitschaft at Köln, bridging to A350 MRTT (6 on order); enables NATO interoperability for extended envelopes.
